Function.Description: The cos function computes the cosine of its argument.

Brief.Overview: The cos function computes the cosine of its argument (an angle expressed in radians).
Brief.Overview-Complex: The cos function returns the cosine of a complex argument expressed in radians (pi radians equals 180 degrees).
Brief.Usage: The cos function is used to compute the cosine of a value.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The cos function is used to determine the cosine of angle when the angle is complex. Do not use if an immediate type, such as a real number, would suffice. Since complex numbers are heap objects, they require more space and operations on these types are slower than on immediate types.

Syntax.Return: Computes and returns the cosine of the Number argument (in radians).

Syntax-Complex.Return: A complex number holding the cosine of the angle.
